meanings.definition: To form a series of curves or scallops.
meanings.sent1: She scolloped the paper edges for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The baker scolloped the pie crust beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The tailor scolloped the fabric edges, making them look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The river scolloped its way through the valley, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The artist scolloped the clay to create a unique design.

meanings.definition: To cook in a sauce, typically with breadcrumbs on top.
meanings.sent1: Mom scolloped the potatoes for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: The chef scolloped the fish in a delicious creamy sauce.
meanings.sent3: The kids were surprised when Dad scolloped the spaghetti with breadcrumbs.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the scolloped dish filled the kitchen with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's specialty was scolloped chicken with a crispy topping.

meanings.definition: Having a wavy or scalloped edge.
meanings.sent1: The scolloped lace on her dress looked elegant.
meanings.sent2: The antique mirror had a beautiful scolloped frame.
meanings.sent3: The scolloped edges of the leaves made them look like tiny waves.
meanings.sent4: The scolloped design on the curtains added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent5: The scolloped border on the invitation gave it a charming touch.
